    <div id="content">
     <article>
      <h1 id="archtitle" itemprop="headline">
       Welcome!
      </h1>
      <div class="description entry-summary clearfix">
       <p itemprop="description">
        Learn how psychiatrists and other mental health professionals categorize mental disorders  from the less common to the more widespread forms of psychological distress, such as depression, obsessive-compulsive disorder, and other mental disorders, this guide provides an index to the diagnostic labels.
       </p>
      </div>
      <section class="featured">
       <h1>
        <span class="lightlinks">
         Featured Resource
        </span>
       </h1>
       <article class="post multiloop featured clearfix" id="toc_personality-disorder">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/personality-disorder/" rel="bookmark" title="Personality Disorders">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <img alt="Photo by ssoosay - //flic.kr/p/7QfyKX" height="214" src="//mhreference.org/lib/wp-content/managed-media/inner-rage-344x214.jpg" width="344"/>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           Personality Disorders
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff,
           <time class="published" datetime="2015-11-20">
            20 November
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          This section describes the sets of symptoms employed by psychiatrists as diagnostic criteria for borderline personality disorder, narcissistic personality disorder, and other personality disorders. Also see Dr Joseph Carvers separate introduction to dealing with personality disorders in relationships.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
      </section>
      <section class="archmore">
       <h1>
        <span class="lightlinks">
         Other Popular Sections
        </span>
       </h1>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_dsm-codes">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/dsm-codes/" rel="bookmark" title="DSM Codes">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14896">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           DSM Codes
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-20">
            20 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          The
          <em>
           Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders
          </em>
          sets out a list of codes which identify each individual diagnosis used by psychiatrists and some other mental health professionals.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_anxiety-disorders">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/anxiety-disorders/" rel="bookmark" title="Anxiety Disorders">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14899">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           Anxiety Disorders
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-20">
            20 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          Learn about symptoms used by psychiatrists and other mental health professionals as diagnostic criteria for panic attacks, posttraumatic stress disorder, and other anxiety disorders.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_adhd">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/adhd/" rel="bookmark" title="Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14897">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-20">
            20 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          Learn more about the diagnosis of Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD)  sometimes called attention deficit disorder (ADD)  and how it is approached differently by the
          <em>
           DSM
          </em>
          and the
          <em>
           ICD
          </em>
          .
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_mood-disorders">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/mood-disorders/" rel="bookmark" title="Mood Disorders">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14902">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           Mood Disorders
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-20">
            20 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          Here you can find general information on clinical depression, bipolar disorder, and other mood disorders, as well as descriptions of the symptoms employed by psychiatrists in their diagnosis.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_schizophrenic">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/schizophrenic/" rel="bookmark" title="Schizophrenia and Schizophrenic Disorders">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14906">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           Schizophrenia and Schizophrenic Disorders
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By MH Resource Research Staff |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-20">
            20 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          Providing general information on schizophrenic disorders, this section also describes the symptoms employed by psychiatrists as diagnostic criteria for disorders such as paranoid schizophrenia and catatonic schizophrenia. Both ICD and DSM approaches are covered here.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
       <article class="multiloop" id="toc_more-mental-health-topics">
        <a href="https://mhreference.org/lib/more-mental-health-topics/" rel="bookmark" title="More Mental Health Reference Topics">
         <header>
          <div class="post_image">
           <div class="post_image_img">
            <span class="imx_sprite sprite-14940">
            </span>
           </div>
          </div>
          <h1>
           More Mental Health Reference Topics
          </h1>
          <div class="meta">
           By Dr Greg Mulhauser, Managing Editor |
           <time class="published" datetime="2014-11-22">
            22 November 2014
           </time>
          </div>
         </header>
         <p class="clearfix">
          While mood disorders, anxiety disorders and other common forms of distress may get more press, this section includes reference materials on many other important areas of mental health.
         </p>
        </a>
       </article>
      </section>
      <div>
       <!--noyarpp-->
      </div>
     </article>
    </div>
